venue.name: Photographic Resource Center at Boston University

item.description:
One exhibit has intimate contemporary portraits in color. The other shows black and white wintery landscapes from the late 19th-early 20th centuries.

We'll meet at the Photographic Resource Center at BU to see "Michal Chelbin: Strangely Familiar." (I missed the previous meetup that John organized for this.) Chelbin's "photographs depict mostly young people who carry their livelihoods with them, often in the very form or function of their bodies. Her subjects are members of itinerant companies— dancers, acrobats, and carnival attractions—and athletes."

And then we'll walk or take the T a couple of stops to Kenmore Square and see: "Heights of Observation: The Photographs of Vittorio Sella" at Panopticon Gallery. "Sella was a consummate photographer who photographed the mountains [the Alps] he climbed as well as the flora, fauna, people and architecture that he encountered along the way."

Afterwards we can get a cup of coffee and chat about the interior and exterior landscapes we've just seen. (This has been cross-listed with the Boston Photo Peeps meetup.)

Here's links to the exhibits:
http://www.bu.edu/prc...

http://www.panopticon...


Directions to the PRC, where we'll meet:
http://www.bu.edu/prc...

Note that admission to the PRC is $4 (or free for members). The PRC is quite small, so we'll have no trouble finding each other. I'm tall and look like my picture.
item.how_to_find_us: It's quite small...we'll have no problem finding each other.
item.name: Photography: Compare and Contrast
